byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY, TED LOOS and ROBIN POGREBIN

abstract: Inside Art column; Christie's schedules November 2015 auction of art from estate of Manhattan couple Anita and Arthur Kahn, including David Smith sculpture valued at $2 to $3 million; eighth annual Governors Island Art Fair in September 2015 will for first time display art at Revolutionary War-era Fort Jay in six underground chambers that once held ammunition and explosives; Gagosian Gallery plans November 2015 show of paintings by Francis Bacon, focusing on works he created from 1978 to his death in 1992.
lead_paragraph: The collection features 400 objects, with a total value estimated at over $50 million, including 80 works by the American sculptor Alexander Calder.

headline.main: Christie’s to Sell Collection of Arthur and Anita Kahn Beginning This Fall
headline.print_headline: Christie’s to Auction New York Collection

snippet: The collection features 400 objects, with a total value estimated at over $50 million, including 80 works by the American sculptor Alexander Calder.
